commit_message:
messaging-publisher: fix threadsafe of flush()

The flush method was concurrency safe in the eventlet word.
But since use threading, it can race. This change uses a lock
to play with the queue.

Change-Id: If4443043ab32ddd3aaf97185a58047a4ea4adc7a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/14/509814/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import threading self.queue_lock = threading.Lock() with self.queue_lock: self.local_queue.append((topic, meters)) with self.queue_lock: self.local_queue.append((topic_name, meter_list)) with self.queue_lock: queue = self.local_queue self.local_queue = [] queue = self._process_queue(queue, self.policy) with self.queue_lock: self.local_queue = (queue + self.local_queue) if self.policy == 'queue': self._check_queue_length() with self.queue_lock: self.local_queue.append((topic, ev_list))
deleted_lines: self.local_queue.append((topic, meters)) self.local_queue.append((topic_name, meter_list)) # NOTE(sileht): # this is why the self.local_queue is emptied before processing the # queue and the remaining messages in the queue are added to # self.local_queue after in case of another call having already added # something in the self.local_queue queue = self.local_queue self.local_queue = [] self.local_queue = (self._process_queue(queue, self.policy) + self.local_queue) if self.policy == 'queue': self._check_queue_length() self.local_queue.append((topic, ev_list))

commit_message:
stabilize test_resize_server_error_and_reschedule_was_failed

The Ia5311ffc12784987c138b127e43cfc52019cb3ea patch tried to fix a fluctuation
in the test_resize_server_error_and_reschedule_was_failed functional test.
But the test still fluctuates even after that patch is merged[1]. Looking back
to the origin patch the problem is obvious and embarrassing. The extra
_wait_for_notification call was introduced _after_ the assert that checks
the number of received notifications. So the original patch never worked.

This patch moves the extra wait call _before_ the assert.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/55/483955/9/check/gate-nova-tox-functional-ubuntu-xenial/209d046/console.html#_2017-10-04_21_52_53_807624

Change-Id: I4c104842cbde587dc9c67f5fde84140252cdcdb5
Closes-Bug: #1717917
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/50/509750/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self._wait_for_notification('compute.exception')

commit_message:
Allow core reviewers to forge commits on mogan

This is useful for fixing up the Nova and Cinder history into the
Mogan master, as a follow-up to
I2769fdb4b37ba0eaaa250ee450fe41be2ae67022 which enabled merge commit
pushing:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122837.html

Change-Id: I33a42ecee4b0f374c182e81ab8d9bcbdb1636edb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/58/510158/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
The ZFS root name needs a default

When using the ZFS storage type the lxc_container_zfs_root_name needs to
be defined. This change simply sets the option by default.

Change-Id: I866eebaf878d387479922bab4160a4427df5b8ac
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-lxc_hosts refs/changes/16/509916/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Set the default zfs root name lxc_container_zfs_root_name: "pool/lxc"

commit_message:
Fix .testr.conf detection: test path follows discover

Apparently if -t is not specified, the path to the unit test directory
follows immediately the "discover" keyword.
This fixes the discovery for the .testr.conf in the sahara repository
(even if is being replaced by .stestr.conf, the fix may still be
useful).

Also, split the code which discover the legacy values in its own function
to simplify the testing.

Finally, disable hacking rule H405 which kept flagging incorrectly a long
multiline string as docstring.

Change-Id: Ide155a8e6b2b746c81388bacc0822c68d853b5a1

commit_message:
Updates for stestr

Per changes to os-testr [1], this patch set updates the code to leverage
stestr and exclude the newly generated .stestr directory

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122135.html

Change-Id: Ic4713af0ad888bd2ca669a5e9de5e9212255e970

added_lines: [DEFAULT] test_path=${OS_TEST_PATH:-./keystonemiddleware/tests/unit} top_dir=./

commit_message:
Align other tox-based project-config publish jobs

Make all of the tox-based project-config publish jobs set tox_envlist in
the job definition and use the shared run playbook. Ensure all of them
are set final: true.

Put the git changed check into tox.ini rather than the job
config.

Move the fetching if ical data into the post playbook, not the run playbook.

Change-Id: Icc69781a50bf3e131baa20f0d4ef9cb95929a390
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/86/509886/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - hosts: all tasks: - name: Collect yaml2ical output synchronize: dest: "{{ zuul.executor.work_root }}/yaml2ical" mode: pull src: "src/{{ zuul.project.canonical_name }}/output" verify_host: true

commit_message:
Register default container policies in code

This commit uses the existing policy-in-code module to move all
default policies for containers into code. This commit also adds
helpful documetation about each API those policies protect, which
will be generated in sample policy files.

bp policy-and-docs-in-code

Change-Id: I0b4b2707fe9bff320b31d64f449fb714efb01bf1

commit_message:
Move nodes to zuulv3

Use roughly 70:30 node allocation for v2:v3 instead of 80:20 since we
have jobs for over 20 hours in v3.

Change-Id: I63c2363d30a504c075bc3fcf972a10515f4b8712
